title: Coca-Cola Sales Up 10% as Demand Holds Amid Rising Prices; Beverage company raises top-line guidance for year as third-quarter sales top Wall Street views
text:
The Atlanta-based company attributed the rise to factors including a 12% jump in price mix, calculated based on changes in operating revenue from its mix of products and the geographic regions those sales occurred.

The beverage company's global case volume increased 4% year over year, driven by strong international sales. Away-from-home markets leading that growth included western Europe and Mexico, the company said.

Sales for sparkling soft drinks grew 3% globally, while sales for nutrition, juice, dairy and plant-based beverages were flat. Sales for hydration, sports, coffee and tea drinks grew 5%, while sports drinks grew 6% year over year.

Overall for the quarter, Coca-Cola posted a net income of $2.8 billion, or 65 cents a share, compared with $2.5 billion, or 57 cents a share, a year earlier.

Revenue came in at $11.1 billion, ahead of analyst estimates for $10.5 billion.

In premarket trading, the stock was up 2.8% at $59.18 a share.

Coca-Cola Sales Up 10% as Demand Holds Amid Rising Prices
